title: Angular impulse - impulse from torque and time

content.description: A disk with rotational inertia <math alttext="I equals 2 kilogram meters squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math> is free to rotate around an axle perpendicular to the plane of the disk and through its center with negligible friction. At time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>, the disk has an angular velocity <math alttext="omega sub 0 equals 2 radians per second" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>ω</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>rad/s</mtext> </mstyle> </math> clockwise, as shown in the figure. A counterclockwise torque <math alttext="tau equals 8 newton meters" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>τ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>8</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>N</mtext> <mo>⋅</mo> <mtext>m</mtext> </mstyle> </math> is exerted on the disk from time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the angular momentum at time <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>s</mtext> </mstyle> </math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="8 kilogram meters squared per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup><mtext>/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="12 kilogram meters squared per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup><mtext>/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="16 kilogram meters squared per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup><mtext>/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="20 kilogram meters squared per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup><mtext>/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="12 kilogram meters squared per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup><mtext>/s</mtext></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
